user.title: Step 1 of 2: Meraki Credentials
user.description: Enter your Meraki API Key and Organization ID.

data_description.meraki_api_key: Your personal API key for the Meraki Dashboard.
data_description.meraki_org_id: The ID of the Meraki Organization you want to add.

init.title: Step 2 of 2: General Settings
init.description: Configure general settings for the Meraki integration.

data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the Meraki API for updates, in seconds.
data_description.enable_device_tracker: Track devices connected to your Meraki networks.
data_description.enable_device_status: Create binary sensors for device online/offline status.
data_description.enable_port_sensors: Create sensors for switch port metrics.
data_description.enabled_networks: Select which Meraki networks to include in Home Assistant.

reauth.title: Re-authenticate Meraki
reauth.description: Your Meraki API credentials need to be updated. Please enter your new API key.

data_description.meraki_api_key: Your personal API key for the Meraki Dashboard.
data_description.meraki_org_id: The ID of the Meraki Organization.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Meraki Integration
reconfigure.description: Update the settings for your Meraki integration.

data_description.enabled_networks: Select which networks to monitor. Leave empty for all networks.
data_description.enable_device_tracker: Enable tracking of clients connected to the network.

abort.already_configured: This Meraki organization is already configured.

network_selection.title: Network Selection
network_selection.description: Configure which networks are monitored by this integration.

data_description.enabled_networks: Select which networks to monitor. Leave empty for all networks.
data_description.enable_device_tracker: Enable tracking of clients connected to the network.

polling.title: Polling & Refresh Settings
polling.description: Configure how often the integration polls the Meraki API.

data_description.scan_interval: Polling interval for frequently changing data like device status and port statistics.
data_description.network_scan_interval: Polling interval for rarely changing data like network and organization structure.
data_description.device_scan_interval: Polling interval for infrequently changing data like device inventory.
data_description.client_scan_interval: Polling interval for very frequently changing data like client information.
data_description.ssid_scan_interval: Polling interval for infrequently changing data like SSID configuration.

display_preferences.title: Display Preferences
display_preferences.description: Configure how the dashboard displays information.

data_description.dashboard_view_mode: Choose how devices are grouped on the dashboard (by network or by device type).
data_description.dashboard_device_type_filter: Filter which device types are shown on the dashboard. You can select multiple types.
data_description.dashboard_status_filter: Default filter for device status on the dashboard.
data_description.temperature_unit: Choose the unit for temperature readings from Meraki sensors (Celsius or Fahrenheit).

notifications.title: Notification Settings
notifications.description:
Coming Soon

Notification settings will be available in a future update.

This feature will allow you to configure alert settings and webhook notifications for Meraki events.

logging.title: Debug Logging
logging.description: Control log verbosity for different features. Use 'Warning' or 'Error' to reduce log noise, or 'Debug' for troubleshooting.

data_description.log_level_mqtt: Real-time MQTT sensor updates (can be chatty).
data_description.log_level_alerts: Webhook alerts from Meraki Dashboard (device down, client connectivity).
data_description.log_level_scanning_api: Scanning API (CMX) client presence and location data.
data_description.log_level_camera: Camera snapshots, streams, and MV device operations.
data_description.log_level_sensor: Sensor entity updates for all device types.
data_description.log_level_switch: Switch, select, number, and text entity operations.
data_description.log_level_frontend: Frontend panel and web UI operations.

data_description.camera_snapshot_interval: How often to refresh camera snapshots on the dashboard (0 = only on demand). Camera streaming uses RTSP and requires the RTSP server to be enabled in the Meraki Dashboard.
data_description.camera_link_integration: Select an integration to filter which cameras are shown when linking Meraki cameras. Choose 'All Cameras' to see all available camera entities.

scanning_api.title: Scanning API Settings
scanning_api.description:
Configure the Meraki Scanning API (CMX) receiver for real-time client location updates.

**Webhook URL:** `{webhook_url}`

Copy this URL to your Meraki Dashboard under Wireless > Configure > Scanning API.

data_description.enable_scanning_api: Enable the Scanning API receiver to receive real-time client presence and location data.
data_description.scanning_api_validator: The validator string from Meraki Dashboard. This will be appended to the webhook URL and returned on GET requests.
data_description.scanning_api_secret: The secret that Meraki will include in POST requests to verify authenticity.
data_description.scanning_api_external_url: Custom external URL for the webhook (e.g., https://ha.example.com). Leave empty to use Home Assistant's configured external URL.

mqtt.title: MQTT Configuration
mqtt.description:
Configure MQTT for MT sensor real-time updates.

Configured Relay Destinations ({destination_count}): {relay_destinations}

data_description.enable_mqtt: Enable MQTT to receive real-time updates from MT sensors via Home Assistant's Mosquitto broker. When enabled, API polling for sensor readings is disabled.
data_description.action: Choose an action to manage external MQTT brokers that will receive relayed sensor data.

mqtt_select_destination.title: {action} MQTT Relay Destination
mqtt_select_destination.description: Select one or more destinations to {action}.

data_description.destinations: Choose a relay destination from the list.

mqtt_destination.title: {action} MQTT Relay Destination
mqtt_destination.description: Configure an external MQTT broker to relay Meraki sensor data to.

data_description.name: A friendly name for this relay destination (e.g., 'IoT Platform').
data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of the external MQTT broker.
data_description.port: The port of the MQTT broker (default: 1883, or 8883 for TLS).
data_description.use_tls: Enable TLS encryption for the connection.
data_description.topic_filter: Topic pattern to match (e.g., 'meraki/v1/mt/#' for all MT sensors).
data_description.device_types: Optionally filter by specific device types.

error.invalid_port: Invalid port number. Must be between 1 and 65535.
